result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on February 7, 2023 at 09:45 am.
Letter to Court Requesting an Adjournment for 1/9/23 hearing

3:22 PM Defendant Christine Mackenzie Scott in court.  Attorney Morgan L. Minter in court for Christine Mackenzie Scott.  Attorney Jacob Nelson Garman in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter scheduled as a status conference.
Defense indicates they have received an offer and have reviewed it. Seeking a plea and sentencing date. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 9, 2023 at 01:30 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Do not drive unless properly licensed. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. 

DEFENDANT IS TO SIGN A COPY OF THIS BOND AND THAT COPY NEEDS TO BE RETURNED TO THE RACINE COUNTY CLERK'S OFFICE FOR FILING. YOU CAN MAIL IN THE BOND TO 717 WISCONSIN AVE, RACINE, WI 53403 OR YOU CAN DROP IT OFF AT THE TRAFFIC AND MIS. OFFICE AT 717 WISCONSIN AVE, RACINE, WI 53403

AMENDED: 9/22/2022: Defendant NOT consume any alcohol or controlled substances. ALL OTHER CONDITIONS REMAIN THE SAME.
